description.narrative: The Provincial Road Improvement and Maintenance (PRIM) Pilot Program is a results-based grant program to incentivise better maintenance of sub-national roads in Nusa Tenggara Barat (NTB) Province and ultimately encourage Indonesia to adopt performance based funding mechanisms for road maintenance. Performance is rewarded by 40% grant reimbursement of maintenance costs upon verification by an independent technical team (TT) led by Bina Marga (Directorate General Highways). By 31 December 2016, approximately 3,587 km of roads had been maintained/ rehabilitated, exceeding the initial target of 2,052 km (2014). Of this total, 2,356 km has been routine maintenance, 1,146 km backlog/minor works, 29 km periodic maintenance and 56 km rehabilitation. The PRIM pilot program has improved the road stability (Kondisi Mantap) of NTB provincial road to 74.7 per cent (from 68.7 per cent in 2014). PRIM has also resulted in the the establishment of a Road Traffic and Transport Forum - http://fllaj.nt
